summary: Thomas Howarth was an employee of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents mentioning him primarily consist of staff payroll records and related forms. Specifically, one document (180-10060-10445) is dedicated to his payroll authorization forms and memoranda, detailing his salary and position changes from 1976 to 1978. While the documents focus on administrative aspects of his employment, they do not explicitly detail his specific role or investigative contributions to the HSCA's work on the JFK assassination. The records highlight the administrative processes related to HSCA staff, including salary adjustments and employment details.
significance: The significance of Thomas Howarth lies in his employment with the HSCA, although the available documents primarily reflect administrative aspects of his role rather than specific contributions to the JFK assassination investigation. His payroll records provide insight into the staffing and financial operations of the HSCA.
